item.title: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin visits Apple Park as Saudi Crown Prince plans meeting with CEO Tim Cook
item.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin met with Apple CEO Tim Cook at the company's newly opened Apple Park campus in Cupertino, Calif., on Friday, where he touted the firm's $350 billion "commitment" to America. A separate report notes Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman is planning to meet with Cook and other tech executives later this month.

item.title: Apple issues sixth watchOS 4.3 beta to developers for review
item.description: Following Apple's iOS 11.3 beta release on Friday, the company issued a sixth version of watchOS 4.3 beta to developers for testing with minor improvements and bug fixes.

item.title: Microsoft's Edge browser comes to Apple's iPad in beta release
item.description: Microsoft is rolling out its Edge Web browser to the iPad in beta form, following up on an iPhone release in November.

item.title: Lowest Prices of 2018: 15" MacBook Pros as low as $2,149 ($250-$300 off); 13" Touch Bars from $1,649; $150-$200 off 27" iMac 5Ks
item.description: Take advantage of the lowest prices of the year on Apple's current generation of Macs at Adorama with discounts of up to $300 off. Pick up a Mid-2017 15" MacBook Pro for just $2,149 or a Mid-2017 13" Touch Bar for $1,649. Premium Mid-2017 27" iMac 5Ks with Radeon 580 graphics start at just $2,299 ($150 to $200 off) -- all with no tax outside NY and NJ.

item.title: Apple debuts new iPhone X 'Unlock' commercial, focusing on Face ID
item.description: New commercial for Face ID shows the potential of unlocking every lock with just a look.

item.title: Apple invites developers to app workshop in Paris' Station F startup incubator
item.description: Apple is believed to be organizing a developer workshop in Paris next week, according to French Apple-specialist media, with the event apparently being held at a tech startup center called 'Station F,' a facility thought to have a small Apple team in residence to help developers working in the incubator.

item.title: The five best iPhone or iPad apps for following March Madness
item.description: It's NCAA Tournament time, that three-week stretch each year when college basketball's best teams square off, and whittle themselves down from 68 teams to four to finally one national champion. AppleInsider has some choices for you, so you can monitor the situation on your iPhone or iPad.

item.title: Steve Jobs job application sells for over $174,000 at auction
item.description: Three items signed by Apple co-founder Steve Jobs have been sold at auction, the most lucrative being a teenage job application which went for roughly $174,757, including the buyer's premium.

item.title: Second iOS 11.3 beta for developers arrives in less than a week
item.description: Four days after the last update, Apple has made available the sixth beta for iOS 11.3 for developer testing.

item.title: How to type accented letters in macOS three different ways
item.description: When writing about people, places, or other things that use accents and other special symbols outside the 26 letters of the standard English alphabet, there are ways to add them to a document without simply using the accentless version of the letter. This AppleInsider guide offers a variety of ways to use the right accent when writing in macOS.

item.title: Lisa Brennan-Jobs to publish coming-of-age memoir 'Small Fry' about life with father Steve Jobs
item.description: Lisa Brennan-Jobs, the daughter of the late Apple co-founder Steve Jobs, is working on a coming-of-age memoir called "Small Fry" due for release in September, one that will tell the story of her childhood while living with the forward-thinking and complex company founder.

item.title: Shuttering Toys 'R' Us stores in United States put Apple products on clearance
item.description: The closure of all Toys 'R' Us stores in the United States could be beneficial for people looking to save money on Apple merchandise, as some of the chain's shuttering retail outlets are discounting the Apple TV, iPod touch, iPads, and other items in the clearance sale.

item.title: Apple's MacBook sales growth may outpace both iPhone and iPad this year
item.description: Apple may be looking at a huge year for MacBooks, with growth having a chance to exceed that of every other Apple product line, including the iPhone and iPad.

item.title: Ubisoft reboots 'Might & Magic' on iPhone, while beta testing for 'Ark: Survival Evolved' on iOS commences
item.description: Two more games heading to iPhone and iPad have opened up for registrations before they launch, with Ubisoft's 'Might & Magic: Elemental Guardians' reviving the RPG franchise in May, while the developers of 'Ark: Survival Evolved' are accepting sign-ups for iOS beta testing.

item.title: Lyft officially begins testing monthly ridesharing subscriptions
item.description: Lyft has reportedly begun testing "All-Access Plans," letting select people receive a certain number of rides for "free" each month with a regular fee.

item.title: Google claims Android is "as safe as the competition" despite its outdated install base
item.description: Google's head of Android security David Kleidermacher claimed in an interview that "Android is now as safe as the competition" on the release of the company's 2017 Android Security report, which seeks to reassure users that it is doing everything it can to protect them from malware and exploits. The problem is that Google can't secure the 2 billion Androids it claims as its platform.

item.title: Apple to host educational event in Chicago on March 27
item.description: Apple on Friday sent an email to AppleInsider and other press outlets, inviting them to an educational event in Chicago scheduled for 10 a.m. local time on March 27.

item.title: AppleInsider Podcast discusses Siri's rocky start, Google Assistant on iPad, and Fitibit for kids
item.description: This week on the AppleInsider podcast, Victor talks about Siri, the spat between people responsible for it, Google Assistant on the iPad, and the problems around a Fitbit for kids.

item.title: SwiftKey updated with new 'Toolbar' for quick access to GIFs, emoji and clipboard text
item.description: Microsoft on Thursday released an update to its SwiftKey predictive keyboard app for iOS and Android, adding a number of enhancements including the Toolbar, an expandable menu that sits atop the keyboard for easy access to frequently used features.

item.title: Review: Anker's new PowerWave Wireless Chargers power your iPhone X & iPhone 8 at 7.5W
item.description: The new PowerWave 7.5 Charging Pad and Charging Stand are the first from Anker to support 7.5W, allowing for quicker charge times that the iPhone 8, iPhone 8 Plus, and iPhone X are capable of now.

item.title: Google's AI-powered Google Lens rolls out on iOS
item.description: Google in a tweet on Thursday said its Google Lens visual search feature will roll out to iOS devices over the coming week as part of update to the company's Google Photos app.

item.title: More Safari exploits demonstrated at Pwn2Own 2018
item.description: The second day of Pwn2Own 2018 saw Apple's Safari exploited twice, with one team completing its attempt within the competition's 30-minute, three-try guidelines, while another group demonstrated a bug in four attempts.

item.title: How to snag an invitation to play Fortnite on iOS and an early hands-on
item.description: Epic Games on Thursday began the process of sending out a first wave of invitations to play the iOS port of its popular game Fortnite, which the company claims will deliver a "full battle royale experience" on mobile. Here's how to sign up.

item.title: The App Store has reportedly been blocked in Iran
item.description: Users in Iran can no longer connect to, download apps from or browse Apple's App Store, as an apparent ban put in place on Thursday is blocking attempts to access the digital storefront.

item.title: Highly questionable video claims to show 'iPhone SE 2' with iPhone X styling
item.description: A dubious video has started to circulate on Weibo that claims to show the upcoming 'iPhone SE 2' using the same design language as the iPhone X, but the smartphone appearing in the brief clip is probably not the follow-up to the iPhone SE, for a number of reasons.

item.title: Major Qualcomm shareholder says he opposed Broadcom bid in hopes of settlement with Apple
item.description: The head of a mutual fund with 8.3 million shares in Qualcomm says he opposed Broadcom's now-aborted $117 billion takeover bid, thinking Qualcomm can do better -- so long as it settles its legal battles with Apple.

item.title: Ex-Apple executives snipe on Twitter following Siri launch account
item.description: The day after an account surfaced that laid out the troubled history of Apple's Siri feature before, at, and after launch, a few of the report's key players are arguing about it on Twitter.

item.title: Play games on your Mac installed on another computer with Steam In-Home Streaming
item.description: If you want to play games on a Mac that has lower specifications than ideally needed to play properly, it is possible to take advantage of the hardware of a more powerful Mac or PC elsewhere on the home network to have a more enjoyable gaming experience. AppleInsider explains how to set up Steam's In-Home Streaming function to remotely play your game collection.

item.title: Apple Music rival iHeartMedia files for bankruptcy protection
item.description: iHeartMedia -- the operator of nearly 850 U.S. radio stations, as well as streaming and concert businesses -- has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, as it looks to cope with more than $20 billion in debt.

item.title: Apple denies French government's 'abusive commercial practices' accusation
item.description: Apple has responded to accusations by the French government that it is taking advantage of the country's developers, dismissing claims of 'abusive commercial practices' by highlighting the funds paid to the nation's iOS app developers and the support it provides to both application producers and their users.

item.title: Killer Deals: Save $50 to $300 instantly on Apple's Mid 2017 MacBook Pros, plus no tax in 48 states & 0% financing [u]
item.description: First come, first served! AppleInsider readers can take advantage of exclusive coupons and instant discounts this week to instantly save between $70 and $300 on every Mid 2017 MacBook Pro, including Apple's 13" MacBook Pro with Touch Bar and 15" MacBook Pro. Plus, sales tax will not be collected on orders shipped outside NY and NJ and systems qualify for 0% OAC.

item.title: Android Wear changes name to 'Wear OS by Google'
item.description: Google announced that it has pivoted its wearables efforts towards "Wear OS by Google," calling it "a wearables operating system for everyone."

item.title: Samsung may compete more directly with Apple's Face ID via 'Galaxy S10'
item.description: In a bid to stay competitive with the Face ID system on Apple's iPhone X, Samsung is reportedly adding 3D sensing cameras to next year's "Galaxy S10."

item.title: 'GrayKey' iPhone unlocking tool revealed as pocket-sized device with questionable security
item.description: The forensic tool known as 'GrayKey' has grave privacy and security implications, a report into the iPhone-unlocking tool suggests, as it has the potential of being misused by thieves and other criminals if the compact device is stolen from members of law enforcement.

item.title: Apple Music Android app gets rare update to solve bugs
item.description: Apple has issued an update to the Android version of Apple Music, fixing two recent problems with the client.

item.title: StarTech debuts a new Thunderbolt 3 Dock with SD card reader and 85W of charging power
item.description: StarTech has unveiled a new Thunderbolt 3 dock, which offers SD Card reading capability, dual-4K display connection, as well as six USB 3.0 ports.

item.title: Apple seeks patent for 'keyless keyboard' concept with haptic feedback
item.description: An Apple patent application for a "Keyless keyboard" suggests the company may be considering a major change to its peripherals and MacBook hardware, by effectively using a touchscreen to create a keyboard with more versatility than a physical version can ever provide.

item.title: WWDC 2018: Apple, Siri and the future of mobile voice automation in iOS 12
item.description: Apple's Worldwide Developer Conference is just over three months away, but we already have some idea of what the company will likely be showing off in iOS 12 to drive the next generation of our mobile devices. Here's a look at Apple's Siri voice assistant and automation.

item.title: Amazon docs suggest original TV shows drew in over 5M more Prime members
item.description: Perhaps explaining Apple's rush to air original TV shows, internal Amazon documents claim that the retailer's own ventures into TV managed to pull in some 5 million Prime subscribers between late 2014 and early 2017.

item.title: Latest Apple Pay promotion offers free song credits for TouchTunes
item.description: In an effort to increase Apple Pay use, Apple is offering a promotion that offers users three free song credits in the TouchTunes jukebox app, if they use the payment service.

item.title: Pair of Apple patent applications describe partial display updates for VR and AR headsets
item.description: The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office has published a pair of patent applications from Apple describing system of switching between selectively updating part of an LED display and the entire screen, one that is described in each application's abstract as being useful for virtual reality or augmented reality headsets.

item.title: Wistron refutes claims of factory work stop over bogus part use in iPhone production
item.description: The iPhone parts supplier is disputing a report that claims that Apple has suspended production at Wistron's plant in Kushan, China because of the use of an unauthorized water seal in the assembly process.

item.title: EU sets Apr. 23 deadline for approving or rejecting Apple's Shazam takeover
item.description: The European Commission has announced an Apr. 23 provisional deadline for a decision on Apple's intended acquisition of Shazam, perhaps the world's most popular song recognition service.

item.title: Safari exploit successfully demonstrated at Pwn2Own 2018
item.description: Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative kicked off its annual Pwn2Own hacking competition on Wednesday with two attempts to exploit Apple's Safari web browser, one of which was successful.

item.title: Apple highlights parental management tools in new 'Families' webpage
item.description: Apple posted a new page to its website on Wednesday highlighting the parental guidance, security, and content management features built into its products and services, from iPhone to Apple TV.

item.title: Apple Maps activates Transit directions in select areas of Arkansas
item.description: Apple recently activated public transit directions in major metropolitan areas of Arkansas, including Little Rock and Jonesboro, further building out the Apple Maps feature for users in the U.S.

item.title: Spotify testing in-app voice assistant feature, suggests work on smart speaker
item.description: Streaming music leader Spotify on Wednesday began testing out a new in-app voice assistant feature that allows users to quickly find songs, albums, playlists, artists and more with a single tap. More interesting are playback controls that suggest potential integration with smart speaker devices.

item.title: App developer statistics show increased Apple Watch Series 3 adoption, decline in older models
item.description: Apple's latest Apple Watch Series 3 device has seen healthy adoption rates since its release last year, while usage rates of older Series 1 and first-generation models are on the decline, according to statistics shared by Pedometer++ developer David Smith.

item.title: Watch: iPhone X takes on Samsung's Galaxy S9+ in benchmarking bonanza
item.description: In the first of a series of comparison video, AppleInsider pits Samsung's Galaxy S9+ against Apple's iPhone X in a barrage of benchmarking tests. Read on to find out which flagship came out on top.

item.title: Apple shares six short films created using 'powerful' iMac Pro [u]
item.description: Looking to market the iMac Pro as "the most powerful Mac ever," Apple has published six short films made using the desktop as the primary tool.
